info.title: Sonar
info.summary: Airbyte's API retrieves data on behalf of your customers and feeds it to your agentic workflows.
info.description:
The API contains 3 types of endpoints:
- `/api/v1/embedded`: end-user-facing API to collect credentials.
- `/api/v1/sonar`: operator endpoints to fetch data from end-user data sources (apis & drives) with their configured credentials.
- `/api/v1/integrations`: all the operator endpoints to manage configurations.

It is recommended to specify the following header in all your http requests:
```yaml
X-Organization-Id: organization's uuid
```
It will ensure that the right organization is used for all the requests in case your user is a member of multiple organizations.
If you only have one organization, it will default to that one, otherwise the call will fail.

post.description: Generate an application access token using client credentials. This endpoint is intentionally unauthenticated - authentication is performed via client_id and client_secret in the request body.
Post a new message to a thread

post.description:
Trigger discovery job for a specific source definition.

This endpoint will:
1. Verify a source template with "discovery-agent" tag exists for this source definition
2. Check if the catalog is blessed (and force flag is not set)
3. Schedule a new discovery job

This enables re-running discovery for sources that need catalog updates.

Args:
    source_definition_id: The source definition ID to run discovery for
    force: If true, allows discovery even on blessed catalogs

Returns:
    DiscoveryAgentCreateResponse with a single job created

Raises:
    HTTPException 404: Source template not found or not tagged with "discovery-agent"
    HTTPException 403: Catalog is blessed and force is not true

schema.description: Whether to annotate foreign keys in the discovered catalog using the catalog annotator agent

get.description:
List all available connector definitions with their auth config specs.

This endpoint returns a list of all connectors including:
- Connector name
- Definition ID (UUID)

The information is extracted from the generated definitions.py file.

Returns:
    ConnectorDefinitionsListResponse with list of connector summaries

parameters.name: x-organization-id

schema.description: The organization ID to target for this request
schema.title: X-Organization-Id

parameters.description: The organization ID to target for this request

post.description:
Create a new connector instance with secure credential storage.

This endpoint:
1. Generates a unique ID for the connector instance
2. Stores auth_config securely in AWS Secrets Manager
3. Saves metadata to the database with RLS protection
4. Returns the created instance ID

Args:
    request: Connector instance creation request
    user_info: Authenticated user information from token
    repository: Connector instance repository
    secret_store: Secret storage backend (AWS Secrets Manager)

Returns:
    ConnectorInstanceCreateResponse with the created instance ID

Raises:
    HTTPException: 400 for validation errors, 500 for storage/database errors

parameters.name: x-organization-id

schema.description: The organization ID to target for this request
schema.title: X-Organization-Id

parameters.description: The organization ID to target for this request

get.description:
Retrieve a connector instance by ID.

This endpoint:
1. Queries the database with both instance_id AND workspace_id for isolation
2. Returns connector instance metadata including secret path (not secret value)
3. Returns 404 if instance doesn't exist or belongs to different workspace/org

Security:
- RLS automatically filters by organization_id
- Explicit WHERE clause filters by workspace_id for workspace-level isolation
- Prevents information disclosure about instances in other workspaces

Args:
    instance_id: UUID of the connector instance
    user_info: Authenticated user information from token
    repository: Connector instance repository

Returns:
    ConnectorInstanceResponse with instance metadata

Raises:
    HTTPException: 400 if workspace_id missing, 404 if instance not found

parameters.name: x-organization-id

schema.description: The organization ID to target for this request
schema.title: X-Organization-Id

post.description:
Execute a connector operation.

- **instance_id**: UUID of the connector instance to execute
- **entity**: Entity name (e.g., "customers", "invoices")
- **action**: Operation (e.g., "list", "get", "create")
- **params**: Operation-specific parameters

Returns a standardized response envelope with execution results.

patch.description:
Manually update organization billing state and sync to Airbyte.

This is an internal admin-only endpoint for testing and emergency use.
It updates the billing state in Sonar and automatically syncs to Airbyte
to ensure workspaces/connections are enabled or disabled appropriately.

Billing State Mapping (Sonar  Airbyte):
    - TRIAL  MANUAL (syncs enabled)
    - ENABLED  MANUAL (syncs enabled)
    - GRACE_PERIOD  MANUAL (syncs enabled, Sonar tracks grace period internally)
    - DISABLED  LOCKED (syncs disabled - Airbyte API doesn't allow DISABLED status)
    - LOCKED  LOCKED (syncs disabled, requires payment)

The mapping ensures that:
    - Paying customers (TRIAL/ENABLED/GRACE_PERIOD) have unrestricted access (MANUAL)
    - Sonar tracks grace period end dates internally without Airbyte involvement
    - Customers who cancel (DISABLED) are locked in Airbyte (LOCKED status)
    - Customers with payment issues (LOCKED) have syncs blocked until payment

Note: Airbyte's DISABLED status is reserved for internal billing automation only.
When Sonar sets DISABLED, we use LOCKED which has the same effect (disables connections).

Grace Period Handling:
    - If grace_period_ends_at is not provided when transitioning to GRACE_PERIOD,
      it will be auto-calculated as +1 day from now (matching webhook behavior)
    - grace_period_ends_at is stored in Sonar DB but NOT sent to Airbyte

Args:
    organization_id: The organization to update
    request: The billing state to set and optional grace period end time

Returns:
    Updated billing state information

Raises:
    HTTPException 404: Organization not found
    HTTPException 500: Failed to sync to Airbyte (will trigger retry)

get.description:
List workspaces for the authenticated organization with cursor-based pagination.

- **name_contains**: Optional filter by workspace name (case-insensitive partial match)
- **status**: Optional filter by workspace status (active or inactive). If not specified, returns all workspaces.
- **limit**: Maximum number of workspaces to return (default: 20, max: 100)
- **cursor**: Pagination cursor from previous response's `next` URL
- **next**: URL for next page (null if no more results)

AgentToolName.title: AgentToolName
AgentToolName.description:
Enum of tool names available to agents.
This enum is automatically synced to the frontend via OpenAPI generation,
ensuring type safety when handling tool calls and responses.
When adding a new tool to an agent (e.g., in app/agents/chat_agent.py),
add the corresponding tool name here to expose it to the frontend.

customization.description:
Customizations for the source template. If stream_whitelist is provided, only the specified streams will be synced.
If stream_customizations are provided, and stream fields specified will override the default settings for only that
field. Where any streams fields are not specified, the default settings will be used.

EncryptionMapper.title: EncryptionMapper
EncryptionMapper.description:
Encryption mapper - encrypts sensitive fields with RSA.

Encrypts specified fields using RSA public key encryption. The encrypted
values replace the original field values in the output stream.

Note: Only RSA encryption is supported. AES is not available due to
secrets hydration issues in the Airbyte platform.

public_key.title: Public Key
public_key.description: RSA public key in PEM format

EncryptionMapperConfig.title: EncryptionMapperConfig
EncryptionMapperConfig.description:
Configuration for encryption mapper - uses snake_case.

Encrypts a specified field using RSA (OAEP-SHA256). The encrypted value
replaces the original field value or is emitted with the configured suffix.

NOTE: Symmetric AES is NOT supported in this API.

Why we don't support AES:
- Secrets hydration for AES mappers is not currently supported in the platform
- AES requires symmetric key management which doesn't align well with
  Sonar's secrets management architecture
- RSA with public keys is more appropriate for this use case as it
  allows encryption without exposing private keys in the configuration

If you need AES encryption, this must be resolved at the platform level
with proper secrets storage and hydration support before we can add it here.

EnrollmentStatusResponse.title: EnrollmentStatusResponse
EnrollmentStatusResponse.description:
Response schema for enrollment status endpoint.

Used to determine if a user is new vs existing, and whether
their organization is enrolled in Sonar.

external_message.title: External Message
external_message.description: User-friendly error message suitable for display

FailureReason.title: FailureReason
FailureReason.description:
Structured failure information from Coral API.
Contains details about why a check or operation failed.

FailureType.title: FailureType
FailureType.description: Categorizes well known errors into types for programmatic handling.

FieldFilteringMapper.title: FieldFilteringMapper
FieldFilteringMapper.description:
Field filtering mapper - removes a specific field from each record.

Filters out a single specified field from the data stream. The targeted
field is removed from all records in the output stream.

Note: This currently supports removing a single field (denylist approach).
To support allowlist filtering (keeping only specified fields), the config
would need to be extended with an allowed_fields list instead of target_field.

FieldFilteringMapperConfig.title: FieldFilteringMapperConfig
FieldFilteringMapperConfig.description:
Configuration for field filtering mapper - uses snake_case.

Filters out a specific field from the data stream.

FieldRenamingMapper.title: FieldRenamingMapper
FieldRenamingMapper.description:
Field renaming mapper - renames a single field per configuration.

Renames one field in the data stream (original_field_name  new_field_name).
Useful for standardizing field names across different data sources.

FieldRenamingMapperConfig.title: FieldRenamingMapperConfig
FieldRenamingMapperConfig.description:
Configuration for field renaming mapper - uses snake_case.

Renames a single field in the data stream.

next.title: Next
next.description: Next page url, empty if no more pages

redirect_url.title: Redirect Url
redirect_url.description: The url to redirect to after getting the user consent

GteCondition.title: GteCondition
GteCondition.description: Greater than or equal: field >= value (equivalent to not lt).

HashingMapper.title: HashingMapper
HashingMapper.description:
Hashing mapper - converts field values to cryptographic hashes.

Applies a hash function (SHA256, SHA512, or MD5) to transform field values.
Can either replace the original field or create a new field with a suffix.

field_name_suffix.title: Field Name Suffix
field_name_suffix.description: Optional suffix for new field with hashed value

HashingMapperConfig.title: HashingMapperConfig
HashingMapperConfig.description:
Configuration for hashing mapper - uses snake_case.

Transforms a field value by applying a cryptographic hash function.
The original field is replaced with the hashed value, or a new field
can be created with a suffix.

InCondition.title: InCondition
InCondition.description: In list: true if field value is in list (equivalent to or [eq, eq...]).

LteCondition.title: LteCondition
LteCondition.description: Less than or equal: field <= value (equivalent to not gt).

NeqCondition.title: NeqCondition
NeqCondition.description: Not equal to: field does not equal value (equivalent to not eq).

oauth_user_input_from_connector_config_s.title: Oauth User Input From Connector Config Specification

OrCondition.title: OrCondition
OrCondition.description: True if any nested conditions are true.

event_id.title: Event Id
event_id.description: The event ID that was processed

OrganizationSignupResponse.title: OrganizationSignupResponse
OrganizationSignupResponse.description:
Response schema for organization signup endpoint.

All non-optional fields are guaranteed to be present:
- organization_name: Always fetched from Airbyte API
- first_workspace_id: Raises HTTPException if not available
- onboarding_status: Has default value (NOT_STARTED) from Organization model

RowFilterCondition.title: RowFilterCondition
RowFilterCondition.description: Condition for row filtering - uses snake_case.

RowFilteringMapper-Input.title: RowFilteringMapper
RowFilteringMapper-Input.description:
Row filtering mapper - filters rows based on field equality.

Only keeps rows where a specific field equals a given value. Rows that
don't match the condition are excluded from the output.

RowFilteringMapper-Output.title: RowFilteringMapper
RowFilteringMapper-Output.description:
Row filtering mapper - filters rows based on field equality.

Only keeps rows where a specific field equals a given value. Rows that
don't match the condition are excluded from the output.

RowFilteringMapperConfig.title: RowFilteringMapperConfig
RowFilteringMapperConfig.description:
Configuration for row filtering mapper - uses snake_case.

Filters rows based on a condition. Only rows where the specified field
equals the provided value are kept.

workspace_name.title: Workspace Name
workspace_name.description: The name of the workspace to create or use.

region_id.title: Region Id
region_id.description: The region in which to create the workspace. If not provided, the default US region will be used. US region: 645a183f-b12b-4c6e-8ad3-99e165603450, EU region: b9e48d61-f082-4a14-a8d0-799a907938cb.

SecretMigrationStatus.title: SecretMigrationStatus
SecretMigrationStatus.description:
Status of secret storage migration during organization enrollment.

- NOT_STARTED: Migration has not been initiated (should not appear in practice)
- IN_PROGRESS: Migration is currently running
- COMPLETED: Secrets successfully migrated from default to organization-specific storage
- FAILED: Migration encountered an error (enrollment continues, status tracked for monitoring)
- NOT_APPLICABLE: No migration needed (CUSTOMER_OWNED storage, or no default secrets to migrate)

selected_streams.title: Selected Streams
selected_streams.description: DEPRECATED: Stream selection is now managed in UI localStorage. This field is no longer used.

selected_streams.title: Selected Streams
selected_streams.description: DEPRECATED: Stream selection is now managed in UI localStorage. This field is no longer used.

is_metric.title: Is Metric
is_metric.description: True if the stream represents aggregated metric data of a specific type. When true, data_category denotes the metric subtype (e.g., cohort). Use data_category='metric' only when the aggregation has no specific type.

workspace_id.title: Workspace Id
workspace_id.description: The workspace in which to create the source.

source_template_id.title: Source Template Id
source_template_id.description: The id of the source template to create the source from.

source_config.title: Source Config
source_config.description: The configuration for the source not already provided by the defaults in the source template (eg, credentials, bucket names). Must match the source template's User Config Spec.

selected_connection_template_tags.title: Selected Connection Template Tags
selected_connection_template_tags.description: Optional list of tags to filter which connection templates will be used for this source.

selected_connection_template_tags_mode.description: Tag selection mode for connection templates: 'all' (must have all tags) or 'any' (must have at least one tag). Defaults to 'any'.

enhanced_error_message.title: Enhanced Error Message
enhanced_error_message.description: LLM-enhanced user-friendly error message (when available). Prefer this over failure_reason.external_message for display when present.

workspace_id.title: Workspace Id
workspace_id.description: The workspace in which to create the source.

source_template_id.title: Source Template Id
source_template_id.description: The id of the source template to create the source from.

source_config.title: Source Config
source_config.description: The configuration for the source not already provided by the defaults in the source template (eg, credentials, bucket names). Must match the source template's User Config Spec.

selected_connection_template_tags.title: Selected Connection Template Tags
selected_connection_template_tags.description: Optional list of tags to filter which connection templates will be used for this source.

selected_connection_template_tags_mode.description: Tag selection mode for connection templates: 'all' (must have all tags) or 'any' (must have at least one tag). Defaults to 'any'.

patch_ops.title: Patch Ops
patch_ops.description: List of JSON Patch (RFC 6902) operations to apply to the catalog.

blessed.title: Blessed
blessed.description: Set to true to mark this catalog as blessed, preventing automatic discovery overwrites.

query.title: Query
query.description: JMESPath query to filter the catalog. Example: `streams[].name` (names only) or `streams[?name=='users']` (users stream only).

result.title: Result
result.description: The result of the JMESPath query on the source definition's catalog

stream.description: The stream to add to the catalog.

patch_ops.description: List of JSON Patch (RFC 6902) operations to apply to the stream.

result.title: Result

original_source_template_id.title: Original Source Template Id
original_source_template_id.description: ID of the source template to clone

name.title: Name
name.description: Optional name for the cloned template. If not provided, uses the original template's name

SourceTemplateCloneRequest.title: SourceTemplateCloneRequest
SourceTemplateCloneRequest.description: Request to clone an existing source template

partial_default_config.title: Partial Default Config
partial_default_config.description: A template configuration containing default values for all those fields that the end user will *not* provide. Personalized fields like resource names or secrets should not be provided here.

customization.description:
Customizations for the source template. If stream_whitelist is provided, only the specified streams will be synced.
If stream_customizations are provided, and stream fields specified will override the default settings for only that
field. Where any streams fields are not specified, the default settings will be used.

field. Where any streams fields are not specified, the default settings will be used.

catalogs.description: Available catalogs with their schemas and tables

ToolResponseEvent.description: Format of tool response events sent to the browser.

data_hosting_type.title: Data Hosting Type
data_hosting_type.description: The hosting type for this connection template. 'user_hosted' means the user provides destination configuration.

destination_definition_id.title: Destination Definition Id
destination_definition_id.description: The id of the destination definition (type of destination connector) to use for the connection.

destination_config.title: Destination Config
destination_config.description: The configuration for the destination connector. Must match the destination definition.

cron_expression.title: Cron Expression
cron_expression.description: A valid Quartz cron expression describing the schedule for the connection.

non_breaking_changes_preference.description: The action Airbyte should take when breaking changes are made to a source schema.

sync_on_create.title: Sync On Create
sync_on_create.description: Whether to start a sync job when the connection is created.

UserHostedConnectionTemplateCreateReques.description: Create request for user-hosted connection templates where the user provides destination configuration.

workspace_name.title: Workspace Name

region_id.title: Region Id
region_id.description: The region in which to create the workspace. If not provided, the default US region will be used. US region: 645a183f-b12b-4c6e-8ad3-99e165603450, EU region: b9e48d61-f082-4a14-a8d0-799a907938cb.

allowed_origin.title: Allowed Origin

selected_source_template_tags.description: Optional list of tags to filter which source templates will be available in the widget.

tags.name: Embedded
tags.description: All the endpoints necessary to retrieve credentials for your end users.

tags.name: Template Connections
tags.description: Operator endpoints to configure default connections setup.

tags.name: Template Sources
tags.description: Operator endpoints to configure default source setup.

tags.name: Template Tags
tags.description: Create, update, list, and delete tags for organizing templates.

tags.name: Destinations
tags.description: List and retrieve configured destination instances in workspaces.

tags.name: Sources
tags.description: Operator endpoints to list all the configured sources.

tags.name: Destinations Definitions
tags.description: List and retrieve destination connector specifications.

tags.name: Cache
tags.description: Execute queries against cache backends (Starburst, ClickHouse) to retrieve and analyze data.

tags.name: Sources Definitions
tags.description: List and retrieve source connector specifications, manage source definition catalogs (streams, sync modes, cursor fields).

tags.name: Workspaces
tags.description: List, retrieve, update, and delete workspaces with filtering and cursor-based pagination; get workspace statistics.

tags.name: Sonar - APIs
tags.description: Operator endpoints to access end user's API sources without requiring credentials.

tags.name: Applications
tags.description: Generate application access tokens using client credentials for OAuth flows.

tags.name: Sonar - Files
tags.description: Operator endpoints to access end user's file sources (GDrive, Sharepoint, S3...) without requiring credentials
